{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3007971,"name":"Soran Ismail","username":"sorrrin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b4bc9f/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-15T18:00:44.395Z","cooked":"

I wondered if anyone could tell me the difference between the FRC image and the FRC firmware that you flash onto the Roborio?

By default, the Rio has a fresh install of the NI Embedded Linux OS, but what does the FRC imaging tool add?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2022-02-15T18:00:44.395Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":25,"reads":117,"readers_count":116,"score":163.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":403057,"topic_slug":"what-is-the-difference-between-the-frc-image-vs-the-frc-firmware","display_username":"Soran Ismail","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51449,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-is-the-difference-between-the-frc-image-vs-the-frc-firmware/403057/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3007979,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-15T18:17:58.328Z","cooked":"

The distinction is similar to that between the BIOS (firmware) and OS (image) on a desktop computer. The FRC image is based on NI Embedded Linux but adds several FRC-specific pieces of software and configuration, such as NetComm and the configuration webserver.

The FRC imaging tool is built to make the RoboRIO imaging process (for both firmware and image) easier and more step-by-step for FRC teams. It too is based on other NI tools/libraries, but handles things like setting the FRC team number in configuration files.

Thank you so much for this clarification!
